mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Martha Washington to Frances Bassett Washington, 1794 December 15
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Martha Washington writes from Philadelphia. Hopes Fanny's children will be well thru winter--uneasy over Dr. David Stuart's illness, but is recovering--sent Maria's shoes to her--Nelly not so much grown as Mr. Lear described, but Wash [George Washington Parke Custis] outgrows his clothes--"I hope that when Nelly has a little more gravatie she will be a good girl. At present she is I fear half crazy." Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, repairs to document. Docketed by Fanny Washington laminated, incomplete watermark (George Washington's). Name on original manuscript appears as "M. Washington".
